Package commandLineApp

Class GeneralStoreManager

java.lang.Object
commandLineApp.GeneralStoreManager
public class GeneralStoreManager
extends java.lang.Object
This class manages the game logic of the GeneralStore in the farm simulator.
Version:
22 May 2020.
Author:
Hayley Krippner, Michelle Muchemwa

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    GeneralStoreManager​(GameManager gameManager, MainMenuManager mainMenuManager)
    This method creates a GeneralStoreManager.

  • Constructor Details

    • GeneralStoreManager

      public GeneralStoreManager​(GameManager gameManager, MainMenuManager mainMenuManager)
      This method creates a GeneralStoreManager. It manages the GeneralStore view options and how the user purchases one or/and multiple FarmObjects.
      Parameters:
      gameManager - The central game controller.
      mainMenuManager - This manages the MainMenu.

  • Method Details

    • startGeneralStoreLoop

      public void startGeneralStoreLoop()
      This method enters the GeneralStore in the game.

    • sayInGeneralStore

      public void sayInGeneralStore()
      This method inform the user that they are in the GeneralStore.

    • askStoreActions

      public void askStoreActions()
      This method asks the user what action they would like to perform in the GeneralStore and gets valid input of an int between 1 and 5. The user can exit the GeneralStore and return to the MainMenu. The action is then requested to be executed.

    • executeAction

      public void executeAction()
      This method executes the desired store action.

    • displayGeneralStore

      public void displayGeneralStore()
      This method displays the GeneralStore's content and each FarmObject's index.

    • askObjToPurchase

      public void askObjToPurchase()
      This method asks which FarmObject the user would like to purchase. The user can cancel and return to the GeneralStore menu. If FarmObject is selected, a request is made for the number of them.

    • objToPurchaseController

      public void objToPurchaseController()
      This method controls what do with the user's choice after asking the which FarmObject they would like to purchase.

    • askNumOfObjToPurchase

      public void askNumOfObjToPurchase()
      This method asks the user how many of the choosen store FarmObject they would like to purchase. It gets valid input. The user can cancel and return to the GeneralStore menu. If a number is chosen, a request for purchasing is made.

    • numObjToPurchaseController

      public void numObjToPurchaseController()
      This method controls what do with the user's choice after asking the how many FarmObjects they would like to purchase.

    • hasEnoughMoney

      public java.lang.Boolean hasEnoughMoney​(Farm farm)
      This method checks if the user has enough money to purchase FarmObjects.
      Parameters:
      farm - The Farm in the game.
      Returns:
      hasEnoughMoney Whether the user can afford the purhcase.

    • getTotalCost

      public double getTotalCost()
      This method calculates the total cost of the desired number of chosen store objects.
      Returns:
      totalCost The total cost of the purchase.

    • purchaseObject

      public void purchaseObject​(Farm farm)
      This method purchases the desired FarmObjects, provided the user can afford to. If they cannot afford to, they are told they do not have enough money.
      Parameters:
      farm - The Farm in the game

    • updateFarmMoney

      public void updateFarmMoney​(Farm farm)
      This method updates the farm balance after the purchase.
      Parameters:
      farm - The Farm in the game

    • purchaseObjectConfirmation

      public void purchaseObjectConfirmation​(Farm farm)
      This method informs the user that their purchase was successful.
      Parameters:
      farm - The Farm in the game

    • notEnoughMoney

      public void notEnoughMoney()

    • viewFarmAnimals

      public void viewFarmAnimals()
      This method displays the Farm's Animals and their index.

    • viewFarmCrops

      public void viewFarmCrops()
      This method displays Farm's Crops and their index.

    • viewFarmerItems

      public void viewFarmerItems()
      This method displays Farm's Items and their index.

    • viewFarmMoney

      public void viewFarmMoney()
      This method displays the Farm's money.

    • viewObjectDetails

      public void viewObjectDetails()
      This method asks which FarmObject the user would like the view the details of. It requests for the details to be viewed. The user can return to the GeneralStore menu.

    • viewObjectDetailsController

      public void viewObjectDetailsController()
      This method controls what do with the user's choice after asking the how many FarmObjects they would like to purchase.

    • viewAnimalDetails

      public void viewAnimalDetails​(Animal animal)
      This method displays the specific Animal and its purchase price.
      Parameters:
      animal - The Animal which the user wants to view the details of.

    • viewCropDetails

      public void viewCropDetails​(Crop crop)
      This method displays specific the Crop and its purchase price, total growing time and selling price.
      Parameters:
      crop - The Crop which the user wants to view the details of.

    • viewItemDetails

      public void viewItemDetails​(Item item)
      This method displays specific the Item and its purchase price and benefit.
      Parameters:
      item - The Item which the user wants to view the details of.

    • exitGeneralStore

      public void exitGeneralStore()

    • setNumOfObjToPurchase

      public void setNumOfObjToPurchase​(int numOfObjToPurchase)

    • setPurchaseObject

      public void setPurchaseObject​(FarmObject purchaseObject)
